title: How to Make Cuban Lunch Candies

methods.name: Peanut Butter, Butterscotch and Chocolate Chipped Candies

steps.headline: Crush potato chips into a bowl.
steps.description: Make sure there are no big chunks.

steps.headline: Add chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and peanut butter chips to a separate bowl.
steps.description: Set aside.

steps.headline: Fill a pot with 5 cups of water and allow the water to boil.
steps.description: Place the bowl with chocolate chips on top of the pot.

steps.headline: Let the mixer melt.
steps.description: After it is done melting, add the crushed potato chips and stir. Remove off of the pot and place on a hot pad. If you want you can add the option of ½ cup peanuts to make it more chunky and crunchy.

steps.headline: Scoop the Cuban Lunch into the muffin cups and allow it to cool.
steps.description: They will harden into a tasty treat. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Crush potato chips into a bowl.
steps.description: Make sure there is a little bit of more chunks, because otherwise the candies will be to runny.

steps.headline: Measure the  chocolate chips and butterscotch chips into a bowl.
steps.description: Set the bowl near your stove so that it will be easy to have access to when needed.

steps.headline: Fill a pot with 4½ cups of water and bring the water to a boil.
steps.description: Place the bowl with chocolate chips on top of the pot.

steps.headline: Let the mixer melt.
steps.description: After it is done melting, and is completely smooth, add the crushed potato chips and mix well. Remove off of the pot and place on a hot pad. If the mixture is still to wet, add some more crushed chips.

steps.headline: Scoop the Cuban Lunch into the muffin cups and allow it to cool.
steps.description: They will harden within a few hours. Serve on a plate or platter. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Crush your potato chips in a bowl as usual.
steps.description: Make sure that you either have more chunky crushed chips or lots of finely crushed chips.

steps.headline: Measure the chocolate chips and place them in a bowl.
steps.description: Cut your Carmel’s into half’s and then measure and place in the bowl with the chocolate.

steps.headline: Fill the pot with 4-5 cups of water and then bring it to a boil.
steps.description: Place your steel bowl on top of the pot.

steps.headline: Stir the mixture continuously until it is smooth.
steps.description: Once it is smooth, slowly pour in the potato chips and stir some more. Then remove the pot from the heat and place on a hot pad.

steps.headline: Place the mixture carefully into little muffin tins using a teaspoon.
steps.description: Because there is Carmel in this recipe, it should only take 10 minutes to set. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Crush your potato chips in a bowl or in the bag.
steps.description: For this recipe, you can either have them finely crushed or done in chunks.

steps.headline: Measure both chips and place them in a bowl.
steps.description: Place the bowl near your stove so that you have easy access to it.

steps.headline: Fill the pot with 4 cups of water and turn the stove on high.
steps.description: Once it water reaches a rapid boil, place the bowl of peanut butter and chocolate chips on top and let it slowly melt. Once smooth, move onto the next step.

steps.headline: Add the crushed chips into the mixture.
steps.description: Stir until all the crushed chips are covered in the melted mixture. Place the pot on a hot pad.

steps.headline: Scoop the Cuban lunch into the mini muffin cups.
steps.description: Let these set for 20 minutes. Place on a plate or platter. These treats are perfect for parties and are delicious. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Peanut Butter, Butterscotch and Chocolate Chipped Candies Crush potato chips into a bowl. Make sure there are no big chunks. Add chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and peanut butter chips to a separate bowl. Set aside. Fill a pot with 5 cups of water and allow the water to boil. Place the bowl with chocolate chips on top of the pot. Let the mixer melt. After it is done melting, add the crushed potato chips and stir. Remove off of the pot and place on a hot pad. If you want you can add the option of ½ cup peanuts to make it more chunky and crunchy. Scoop the Cuban Lunch into the muffin cups and allow it to cool. They will harden into a tasty treat. Enjoy! Chocolate and Butterscotch Chipped Candies Crush potato chips into a bowl. Make sure there is a little bit of more chunks, because otherwise the candies will be to runny. Measure the  chocolate chips and butterscotch chips into a bowl. Set the bowl near your stove so that it will be easy to have access to when needed. Fill a pot with 4½ cups of water and bring the water to a boil. Place the bowl with chocolate chips on top of the pot. Let the mixer melt. After it is done melting, and is completely smooth, add the crushed potato chips and mix well. Remove off of the pot and place on a hot pad. If the mixture is still to wet, add some more crushed chips. Scoop the Cuban Lunch into the muffin cups and allow it to cool. They will harden within a few hours. Serve on a plate or platter. Enjoy! Carmel and Chocolate Chipped Candies Crush your potato chips in a bowl as usual. Make sure that you either have more chunky crushed chips or lots of finely crushed chips. Measure the chocolate chips and place them in a bowl. Cut your Carmel’s into half’s and then measure and place in the bowl with the chocolate. Fill the pot with 4-5 cups of water and then bring it to a boil. Place your steel bowl on top of the pot. Stir the mixture continuously until it is smooth. Once it is smooth, slowly pour in the potato chips and stir some more. Then remove the pot from the heat and place on a hot pad. Place the mixture carefully into little muffin tins using a teaspoon. Because there is Carmel in this recipe, it should only take 10 minutes to set. Enjoy! Peanut Butter Chocolate Chipped Candies Crush your potato chips in a bowl or in the bag. For this recipe, you can either have them finely crushed or done in chunks. Measure both chips and place them in a bowl. Place the bowl near your stove so that you have easy access to it. Fill the pot with 4 cups of water and turn the stove on high. Once it water reaches a rapid boil, place the bowl of peanut butter and chocolate chips on top and let it slowly melt. Once smooth, move onto the next step. Add the crushed chips into the mixture. Stir until all the crushed chips are covered in the melted mixture. Place the pot on a hot pad. Scoop the Cuban lunch into the mini muffin cups. Let these set for 20 minutes. Place on a plate or platter. These treats are perfect for parties and are delicious. Enjoy! Finished.
